text: The women's tournament of Water polo at the 2016 Summer Olympics at Rio de Janeiro, Brazil, began on 9 August and ended on 19 August 2016. Games were held at the Maria Lenk Aquatic Center and the Olympic Aquatics Stadium. The United States won the gold medal by defeating Italy 12–5 in the final. Russia captured bronze, beating Hungary 19–18. ==Competition schedule== {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font-size:90%; line- height:1.25em;" width=60%; |- |bgcolor="#FFBBBB" align=center|G||Group stage |bgcolor="#BBF3FF" align=center|QF||Quarter-finals |bgcolor="#BBF3BB" align=center|SF||Semi-finals |bgcolor="#FEDCBA" align=center|B||Bronze medal match |bgcolor="#FFFFBB" align=center|F||Final |- |} {| class="wikitable" style="margin:0.5em auto; font-size:90%; line-height:1.25em; text- align:center;" |- ! Total !! colspan="2"| !! 8 !! |} ==Draw== The draw was held on 10 April 2016. Teams from eight nations compete in the tournament and were seeded into two groups for the preliminary round. ===Seeding=== The seeding was announced on 10 April 2016. {| class="wikitable"
